name: azure-resource-health
label: Azure Resource Health
description: Azure Resource Health helps you diagnose and get support for service problems that affect your Azure resources, it reports on the current and past health of your resources. This connector supports actions related to availability status and events.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: resource
fields.description: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Client ID
fields.name: client_id
fields.description: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Client Secret
fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.

fields.title: Tenant ID
fields.name: tenant_id
fields.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

fields.title: Auth Code
fields.name: code
fields.description: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the Delegated Permissions method section.

fields.title: Redirect URL
fields.name: redirect_url
fields.description: The redirect_url of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_url's you have registered in your app registration portal.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Availability Status
operations.description: Retrieves current availability status for a single resource from Azure Resource Health

parameters.name: subscription_id

parameters.description: Specify the name of the resource group from Azure portal.

parameters.title: Resource Provider Name
parameters.name: resource_provider_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the resource provider from Azure portal. eg: Microsoft.Compute Please find the link https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/azure-services-resource-providers

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Specify the name of the resource type from Azure portal. eg: virtualMachines

parameters.title: Resource Name
parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the resource from Azure portal.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Use filter expressions to filter and return only those results that match the expressions specified.
